meta.job_title: Deputy Chief, Agile & Citizen Product Group

duties_responsibilities.duty: Own the product life cycle for Agile Delivery, Citizen Development, and Software Engineering Platform product lines.
Provide leadership in agile transformation and drive the digital agenda and roadmaps for application and/or infrastructure products.
Manage a team of product directors with agile coaches to define the launch of new products and services, develop technical roadmaps, and deliver product features in an agile environment.
Lead the establishment of a center of excellence to streamline processes, create efficiencies, and help teams deliver better products in a faster, more efficient way.
Set the direction for low code development, provide oversight, establish rules of engagement for Citizen Developers, and develop an adaptive governance framework.
Establish application development standards, secure coding techniques, and design patterns and methodologies for all development platforms.
Lead the development of transformation roadmaps with long and short-term plans for new and improved processes and policies.
Maintain contact with key IT suppliers and collaborate with IT Business Management Services to identify procurement contracts.

Direct the development of Information Technology products and plans, identify opportunities for cost-effective investment in IT systems and resources, and develop disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

Coordinate consultation with stakeholders to define business and systems requirements for new technology implementations and provide direction on evaluation, selection, implementation, and maintenance of information systems.
Participate in overall business planning, monitor product lifecycles, and ensure continuous product services delivery through oversight of service level agreements.
Advise on the selection, prioritization, development, and implementation of applications, infrastructure, and related products.
Develop business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for IT spending and initiatives while advising on continued education training programs and career development for IT staff.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, Finance, or Information Services (Master’s preferred) plus a minimum of 14 years of Information Technology experience with at least 8 years of progressive IT managerial experience.
